title: Getting Started with Java Web Development
content:
Introduction

Java has been a cornerstone of web development for decades. In this article, we'll explore the basics of building web applications using pure Java.

Why Java for Web?

  • Robust and mature ecosystem
  • Strong typing and compile-time checking
  • Excellent performance
  • Wide industry adoption

Getting Started

First, you'll need to set up your development environment. Make sure you have:

  1. JDK 11 or higher installed
  2. A text editor or IDE
  3. Basic understanding of HTTP

Your First Handler

Here's a simple example of handling HTTP requests:

public void handle(HttpExchange exchange) {
    String resp;
    exchange.sendResponseHeaders(200, response.length());
    exchange.getResponseBody().write(response.getBytes());
}

Conclusion

Java web development might seem complex at first, but with practice, you'll find it powerful and reliable.
summary: Learn the fundamentals of building web applications with Java. This guide covers servlets, HTTP handling, and basic web architecture.
